title: Which sentence is grammatically correct?
a: Her and I are going to the store.
b: Me and her are going to the store.
c: She and I are going to the store.
d: Me and she are going to the store.
correct_answer: She and I are going to the store.

title: Identify the sentence with the correct subject-verb agreement?
a: The team is playing well together.
b: The team are playing well together.
c: The team am playing well together.
d: The team is play well together.
correct_answer: The team is playing well together.

title: Choose the sentence with the correct use of the past perfect tense?
a: I will have finished my homework before dinner.
b: I will finish my homework before dinner.
c: I finished my homework before dinner.
d: I finished my homework after dinner.
correct_answer: I will have finished my homework before dinner.

title: Which sentence uses correct punctuation?
a: The cat, and the dog played together.
b: The cat and the dog played, together.
c: The cat and the dog, played together.
d: The cat and the dog played together.
correct_answer: The cat and the dog played together.

title: Identify the sentence with the correct use of apostrophes?
a: The dogs leash is too long.
b: The dog's leash is too long.
c: The dogs' leash is too long.
d: The dogs leash's is too long.
correct_answer: The dog's leash is too long.

title: Choose the correct sentence with proper parallel structure?
a: She likes reading, swimming, and to hike.
b: She likes to read, swim, and hike.
c: She likes reading, swimming, and hiking.
d: She likes to read, swimming, and hiking.
correct_answer: She likes to read, swim, and hike.

title: Identify the sentence with the correct word usage?
a: Your going to love this movie.
b: You're going to love this movie.
c: You going to love this movie.
d: Yore going to love this movie.
correct_answer: You're going to love this movie.

title: Choose the sentence with the correct placement of adjectives?
a: The red big balloon floated away.
b: The big red balloon floated away.
c: The balloon big red floated away.
d: The balloon red big floated away.
correct_answer: The red big balloon floated away.

title: Identify the sentence with the correct use of the subjunctive mood?
a: If I was you, I would apologize.
b: If I were you, I would apologize.
c: If I be you, I would apologize.
d: If I would be you, I would apologize.
correct_answer: If I were you, I would apologize.
